statements: SELECT * FROM customer_demographics WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY city DESC
SELECT customer_id, gender, income FROM customer_demographics WHERE gender = 'Male'
SELECT age, city FROM customer_demographics WHERE income < 50000
SELECT * FROM customer_demographics WHERE gender = 'Female' AND age >= 25
SELECT customer_id, income, gender FROM customer_demographics WHERE city = 'New York'
SELECT * FROM customer_demographics WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY income DESC;
SELECT customer_id, gender, age FROM customer_demographics WHERE city = 'New York';
SELECT MAX(income) AS max_income, AVG(age) AS avg_age FROM customer_demographics WHERE gender = 'Male';
SELECT customer_id, city, income FROM customer_demographics WHERE income > 50000 AND gender = 'Female' ORDER BY age ASC;
SELECT COUNT(customer_id) AS total_customers, SUM(income) AS total_income FROM customer_demographics WHERE city LIKE '%on%' OR gender IS NULL;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE age > 30;
SELECT name, age, city FROM customers WHERE gender = 'Female';
SELECT customer_id, name, address, city, state FROM customers WHERE zip_code LIKE '94%';
SELECT * FROM customer_segments WHERE segment_name = 'VIP';
SELECT segment_name, description FROM customer_segments;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT name, age, city FROM customers WHERE gender = 'Male' ORDER BY age;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE state = 'California' AND age BETWEEN 20 AND 40;
SELECT name, address, city, state, zip_code FROM customers WHERE city = 'New York' ORDER BY name;
SELECT c.name, cs.segment_name FROM customers c JOIN customer_segments cs ON c.customer_id = cs.segment_id;
SELECT * FROM customer_demographics WHERE age > 30
SELECT customer_id, gender, location FROM customer_demographics ORDER BY gender ASC
SELECT segment_name, criteria FROM marketing_segments WHERE criteria LIKE '%loyal%'
SELECT customer_id, age, gender, location FROM customer_demographics WHERE gender = 'Female'
SELECT purchase_id, total_amount, customer_id FROM purchases ORDER BY total_amount DESC
SELECT * FROM customer_demographics WHERE age > 30 AND gender = 'Male'
SELECT customer_id, age, gender FROM customer_demographics ORDER BY age DESC
SELECT location, COUNT(*) FROM customer_demographics GROUP BY location
SELECT * FROM purchases WHERE total_amount > 1000 ORDER BY purchase_date DESC
SELECT segment_name, criteria FROM marketing_segments
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT first_name, last_name, age FROM customers WHERE gender='Male';
SELECT purchase_id, product_name, price, quantity FROM purchases ORDER BY purchase_date DESC;
SELECT customer_id, income, education_level, occupation, children_count FROM demographics WHERE income > 50000;
SELECT campaign_id, campaign_name, start_date, end_date, budget FROM marketing_campaigns WHERE target_segment='Young Adults';
SELECT first_name, last_name, age FROM customers WHERE location = 'New York';
SELECT customer_id, product_name, purchase_date, price*quantity AS total_price FROM purchases WHERE price > 100;
SELECT customer_id, income, education_level FROM demographics WHERE occupation = 'Engineer';
SELECT * FROM customers LEFT JOIN demographics ON customers.customer_id = demographics.customer_id;
SELECT campaign_name, start_date, end_date, budget*1000 AS budget_in_thousands FROM marketing_campaigns WHERE target_segment = 'Females';
SELECT * FROM customer_demographics;
SELECT customer_id, age, gender FROM customer_demographics ORDER BY age DESC;
SELECT customer_id, income FROM customer_demographics WHERE income > 50000;
SELECT * FROM customer_purchases WHERE product_name LIKE 'Apple%' ORDER BY purchase_date DESC;
SELECT segment_name, age, gender FROM customer_segments JOIN customer_demographics ON customer_segments.customer_id = customer_demographics.customer_id;
SELECT * FROM customer_demographics WHERE age > 30 ORDER BY gender DESC;
SELECT customer_id, gender, income FROM customer_demographics WHERE gender = 'Male' ORDER BY income DESC;
SELECT c.customer_id, c.product_name, p.purchase_date FROM customer_purchases p JOIN customer_demographics c ON p.customer_id = c.customer_id WHERE c.age < 40 ORDER BY p.purchase_date ASC;

SELECT cd.customer_id, ci.interest_category, cs.segment_name FROM customer_interests ci JOIN customer_demographics cd ON ci.customer_id = cd.customer_id JOIN customer_segments cs ON cs.customer_id = ci.customer_id WHERE cs.segment_name = 'High Value' ORDER BY cd.customer_id;
SELECT cc.contact_id, cc.email, c.age, c.gender FROM customer_contacts cc JOIN customer_demographics c ON cc.customer_id = c.customer_id WHERE c.income > 50000 ORDER BY c.age DESC, cc.email ASC;
